content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is an example of how you can solve this problem in Julia:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Find all code blocks using regex
    matches = collect(eachmatch(r"```julia\n(.*?)\n```", md, seed=1))
    
    if isempty(matches)
        return ""  # Return empty string if no code blocks found
    end

    # Remove code fences and join the code blocks together with a newline
    code = reduce((a, b) -> a * "\n" * b, matches) do acc, match
        replace(match.captures[1], "`" => "")
    end
    
    return code
end
```
This function uses regular expressions to find all the code blocks in the markdown document. It then removes the code fences and joins the code blocks together with a newline. If no code blocks are found, it returns an empty string. 

Please note that this function assumes that the code blocks are correctly formatted as per the markdown language (i.e., they start and end with three backticks (```), followed by "julia" on the next line). It also assumes that there is no other text within the code block that might contain a newline character.
